intro: Cybianthus spichigeri, commonly known as the Sierra Madre lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its bulbs are an important part of its life cycle, storing nutrients for growth and flowering. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
